bwwExcerpt: Written by Robert Askins and directed by Moritz von Stuelpnagel, Hand To God plays like an obsidian black farce which turns on those stock elements of farce - violence, sex and religion. The extremity of those elements and their use here is what differentiates this from a run of the mill farce. And the fact that, once you have wiped away the tears of laughter, unlike most farces, images and concepts remain with you.
